content.text:
## Documentation Updates

A new remote deployment guide has been added to the documentation (PR #3501). Additionally, weekly contributor meeting notes for February 4 and 11, 2025 have been published (PR #3484). A fix was implemented for incorrect image paths in the Korean documentation (PR #3489).

## Feature Enhancements

Discord integration has seen significant improvements with both a new Discord test implementation (PR #3478) and enhancements to the existing Discord test (PR #3498). A new ElevenLabs plugin has been added to the system (PR #3452).

## Bug Fixes and Testing Improvements

Several bug fixes have been implemented, including fixes to the client UI (PR #3496), ensuring the test runner continues execution after failures (PR #3490), and removing '--no-frozen-lockfile' from the Dockerfile (PR #3428). The test suite for OpenAI integration has been completed (PR #3495).

## Other Improvements

Additional system improvements include adding the right parameters for caching and length for local embedding on Anthropic (PR #3497) and adding Compass plugin environment variables (PR #3494).

categories.title: Recent Pull Requests in the elizaOS/eliza Repository

content.text:
Several significant pull requests have been made to the elizaOS/eliza repository recently, focusing on architecture improvements and feature updates:

- PR #3508 by normand1 proposes to delete plugins from the codebase.

- PR #3486 by 0xbbjoker introduces Vector Dimensions and Character Schema Updates, which appears to be enhancing the data structure for characters in the system.

- PR #3509 by odilitime moves characters out to a submodule, which is likely a refactoring effort to improve code organization.

- PR #3482 by Bijan-Massoumi adds a plugin for Messari Copilot, introducing new functionality to the system.

- PR #3512 by HashWarlock updates the 'tee' feature, though specific details about this update aren't provided in the source.

- PR #3511 by tenthirtyone refactors string literals in the client code, replacing hardcoded 'http://localhost' references with the 'SERVER_URL' environment variable, which improves configuration flexibility.

categories.title: Recent Issues in the Eliza GitHub Repository

content.text:
Several issues have been reported in the Eliza GitHub repository recently:

1. Issue #3491 suggests adding a platform interface to the core package for Eliza v2, proposed by user roninjin10.

2. Issue #3504 reports a Twitter Profile Fetch Failure when using the Eliza AI Agent with ProtonVPN on Ubuntu, reported by MehmoodSheikh.

3. Issue #3503 is a request for help with the Obsidian Plugin from user wolfskyknight.

4. Issue #3513 describes a problem where the client shows a blank page and errors, reported by kon-rad.

5. Issue #3514 documents a port scanning error on Render, reported by Etette.

These issues span various aspects of the Eliza system, from core functionality and platform integration to specific deployment environments and plugin compatibility.

The elizaos/eliza repository showed significant activity over a two-day period. From February 14-15, 2025, there were 20 new pull requests with 12 merged, 4 new issues created, and 24 active contributors working on the project. Activity decreased the following day (February 15-16, 2025) with only 2 new pull requests (none merged), 2 new issues, and 9 active contributors.
sources: From 2025-02-14 to 2025-02-15, elizaos/eliza had 20 new PRs (12 merged), 4 new issues, and 24 active contributors.
From 2025-02-15 to 2025-02-16, elizaos/eliza had 2 new PRs (0 merged), 2 new issues, and 9 active contributors.
